docs.title: Welcome
docs.text:
Join at Slido.com to participate in today's polls! Participant Code: #ControlHub

Join the conversation in our Webex Space, Optimizing Webex Suite for Control Hub Administrators.

docs.title: Learning objectives
docs.text:
By the end of the lab, participants will:

  1. Understand the Webex Suite workloads and how they provide solutions across industries and personas.  

  2. Configure and optimize each workload (Meetings, Messaging, Calling, Events, Vidcast, Slido, Whiteboard, etc.) using Control Hub.  

  3. Tailor deployments to meet the needs of different personas and organizational roles.

docs.title: Lab deliverables
docs.text:
Participants will leave the lab with:

  1. A fully configured Webex Suite deployment tailored to the organizational needs of the example customer.

  2. A detailed understanding of settings for all Webex workloads (Meetings, Messaging, Calling, etc.).

  3. Resources and tools to monitor adoption, troubleshoot issues, and optimize services.

docs.title: Customer scenario
docs.text:
Company Name: Pixel Pals Studios Industry: Video Game Development Creates colorful, family-friendly video and mobile games

Employees: Full-time game designers, artists, marketing, administrative and IT Anita Perez, Charles Holland, Rebekah Barretta, Ricardo Filice, Taylor Bard

Contractors: Freelance voice actors, musicians, and independent testers hired for specific game launches Kellie Melby, Eric Steele, Stefan Mauk

In this lab, you’ll simulate a real-world organization, Pixel Pals Studios, that employs both full-time employees and external contractors. To maintain security and productivity, the IT admin needs to ensure that full-time employees have access to the full range of Webex Suite features, while contractors are assigned a more restricted set of tools to minimize security risks and unnecessary access.

docs.title: Resources
docs.text:
Webex Academy

Webex Help Center

Webex Adoption: Set up for success

Webex Adoption: Launch kits

docs.title: Lab 10 - Alerts and analytics
docs.text: Now that we've configured Webex Suite settings, groups, locations, and users, let's explore how to stay informed and proactive by using alerts and analytics.

docs.title: Alerts
docs.text:
Use case and solution Control Hub > Alert Center Alert Center is where critical alerts created automatically by Webex services will show. Looks like you’re all caught up for now! Alerts > All alerts

Let’s look how we can get notification on a prebuilt rule that may be of importance to us.

We’re usually on top of these types of things, but I like all the notifications I can get!

The IT staff needs be alerted if my SSO Identity Provider (IdP) certificate is expiring so I can renew it before it interrupts service for end-users.

Manage > All rules

SSO IDP Certificate expiry

  • Email: Enable – add any email
  • Webex space: Enable
    • This will create a space with the first alert. You could also use an existing space.

There isn’t a standard rule that meets our needs for devices, so let’s create our own. We’re choosing devices, but note that you can also create rules for Meetings and Calling.

RoomOS operational alerts in Control Hub inform admins about issues with Cisco RoomOS devices like Webex Boards and Desk, helping quickly detect and fix problems to keep meetings smooth.

That is – you can avoid those panicked calls from users that join their important meeting that is in 5 minutes!

Manage > Create rule

  • Summary
    • Service: Devices
    • Type: RoomOS operational alerts
    • Severity:High
    • Title – RoomOS Code Red
    • Target – All devices
  • Delivery channel
    • Email: enable
      • Email address: admin@pps.com
    • Webex space: enable
      • 1 to 1 bot: enable
      • Email address: bot@pps.com

Review the rule you created or make changes.

Manage > My rules

RoomOS Code Red

Think about it: What alerts do you need to see in the Alert Center in the mornings while you drink your coffee and for which do you need notifications?

docs.title: Analytics
docs.text:
Description Control Hub > Monitoring > Analytics

No action to take but observe the summary page.

Summary
  • Click across the top options and note the different widgets providing data. (Meetings, Messaging, Calling, etc.)

Let’s check utilization of the Rainbow Think Tank! When you start adding more workspaces and devices, there are times when you’d like to review one workspace.

Workspaces > Filters
  • Select a dimension
    • Workspace name
      • Check Rainbow Think Tank
  • There's no data, but explore the widgets

Control Hub Administrators can customize the summary page and add widgets containing the content they want to see.

Admins can also create new dashboards and organize them by sections. Imagine having one place to see everything that is important to you! What better way to “optimize”.

Create a dashboard with multiple sections, each with data for a different workload My Dashboards > Add Dashboard > Edit Dashboard
  • New Dashboard 1 tab: Change name to Cross-Service Analytics
    • Click into the tab. It's to the right of Summary.
  • Change Section Name 1: Meetings
    • Click on the text in the horizontal box
  • Add Widgets
    • Service: Meetings
    • Metrics: All
    • Dashboard section: Meetings
    • Available Widgets: Select 5
      • Note the KPIs, Charts, & Tables
      • Use the plus sign to add & make sure to click Add widget at the bottom
  • Create a new section
    • Scroll down to find the plus sign
  • Follow steps above starting with "Change Section Name"
    • This time you chose a name and a service!

Think about it: What do you need to see on your dashboard to continue to optimize Webex as usage ebbs and flows?

docs.title: Lab 1 - Getting to know Control Hub
Getting to know Control Hub
docs.text:
Whether you’re new to Control Hub or already familiar with it, let’s check out a few things before we jump into optimization!

Navigation Tasks Control Hub top navigation bar > Cisco AI Assistant Logo

Not the search bar!

Ask Cisco AI Assistant: What is the overview page in Control Hub? Overview Locate the following:
  • Total devices
  • Total users
  • What's new
Left Navigation Locate and explore:
  • Locations
  • Users
  • Organization Settings
  • Meetings
  • Messaging
Control Hub top navigation bar > Cisco AI Assistant Logo

Not the search bar!

Ask Cisco AI Assistant: How do I prevent getting logged out of Control Hub? Management > Organization Settings > Control Hub Idle Timeout Change the timeout to 8 hours

Think about it: What stood out to you on the Overview page? Which shortcuts would be helpful for you?

docs.title: Lab 6 - Calling
docs.text:
Webex Calling provides a robust set of features to enhance your organization's communication, and it’s all in the cloud. In this lab, you'll review and optimize key Webex Calling service settings, then adjust client-specific settings as needed. Finally, you'll import and apply feature changes for your Calling users to ensure the best experience across your organization.

The Calling settings chart shows which Calling settings are set by default and which you can change for groups using a template or bulk tools to override. Use the chart as a quick reference to see default settings versus customizable options to fit your organization’s needs

docs.title: Service settings
docs.text:
Use Case & Solution Control Hub > Services > Calling > Settings > Service Note: Most individual settings require clicking save before moving to the next setting. IT security policies dictate that voicemail passcodes be reset at a regular interval.
  • Set the time period for passcode expiration.

Voicemail

  • Set the number of days after which passcode expires to 30
Employees have complained about the number of spam calls they receive.
  • Create a call block list.

Call Block List

  • Enable: Block calls from hidden/private numbers
Enabling call recording announcements ensures call participants are informed, supporting legal compliance and transparency. Local laws require all emergency calls be recorded.
  • Turn on compliance announcements and emergency call recording.

Call Recording

  • Compliance announcements: Enable play announcement for inbound and outbound PSTN calls
  • Record emergency calls: Enable
For training and compliance, all employee calls should be recorded. Manage User Calling Data

Bulk change recording access

All Locations > Download Data

  • Specific user data for download:
    • Recording
    • Voicemail
  • Once download is initiated, go to View upload history tasks to download the most recent file
Edit the CSV file
    All employees
    • Column GP Call Recording enabled: TRUE
    • Column GQ Call Recording type: Always
        These are case sensitive!
    Contractors
    • Kellie Melby, Eric Steele, Stefan Mauk
    • Column B: Voicemail enabled – FALSE

    Upload CSV file. You should see that 8 records have been updated.

All users have the same physical phone and need the same speed dial button configured.

  • Create a Line Key Template
Device

Configure Default Device Settings > Line Key Templates > View Templates > Create custom template

  • Template name: 9851 Speed Dial
  • Device Model: Cisco 9851
  • Assign Line Key
    • Order 2: Speed dial
    • Line Key Label: Cisco Support
    • Destination: 18005536387
  • Assign template
    • Locations: PPS Corporate
    • Current device layout: Default Layout
    • 8 devices will be found. Apply Custom Layout.

docs.title: Webex App settings and template
docs.text:
Use Case & Solution Control Hub > Services > Calling > Settings Company policy dictates that users cannot block their caller id or manage any of their voicemail settings in the Webex App and/or User Hub (user.webex.com)
  • Remove caller ID and voicemail settings from User Hub.

Webex App > Hide Calling Settings

  • Call Settings: Disable Block caller ID
  • Voicemail: Disable all
Contractors should not be able to share content or request/give remote control of shared content.
  • Change sharing settings using a template for the contractors.

Templates > Webex App > Create template

  • Template name: PPS Contractors
    • Description: Disable Sharing
  • Disable:
    • Request remote control
    • Give remote control
    • Screen sharing
  • Apply template to PPS Contractor group

Think about it: Which Calling settings might need to be changed for your organization or for certain groups?

docs.title: Lab 8 - Devices and workspaces
docs.text: Webex devices and workspaces enhance collaboration across the Webex Suite, supporting a secure and productive hybrid work environment. In this lab, you'll create and configure both shared and personal workspaces and explore the features available for each. You'll also get hands-on experience with Cisco's Workspace Designer.

docs.title: Assigning devices
docs.text:
Use case & solutions

Control Hub navigation Remember that line application template we implemented in the Calling lab?Let’s take a look to see if it was assigned to our users’ existing devices! Management > Devices > Select any Cisco 9851
  • Device Management > Configure Layout > Line Key Configuration
  • Notice the speed dial we configured in the Calling lab.
    • It’s that easy to apply that template to multiple devices!
Anita Perez has a phone in the office but will also need a physical phone in her home office.
  • Assign a Cisco 9841 to Anita Perez.
Management > Devices > Add device
  • Personal usage
  • User: Anita Perez
  • Cisco Desk Phone: Cisco 9841
  • Setup: By Activation code
  • Activation code will be provided.
  • This code would then be entered on the device by Anita, but we will not need it for this lab.

docs.title: Workspaces
docs.text:
Use case & solution

Control Hub navigation

Users in the office need a quiet space to focus and make phone calls using their own identities.

  • Set up an existing workspace with a hotdesking device. Hotdesking allows users to sign in and book a shared phone for their workday.

Management > Workspaces > Workspace 1

  • Actions: Edit
    • Name: Quiet Pod 1
    • Type: Focus Area
    • Capacity: 1
  • Overview
    • Devices: Add device
    • Cisco Desk Phone: Cisco 9871
      • By Activation Code
      • This code would then be entered on the device, but we will not need it for this lab.
    • Scheduling
      • Hot desk sign in: Enable

The RainbowRaccoon game development team needs a dedicated workspace for team meetings that has a device to make collaboration efficient.

  • Set up a workspace to accommodate the large team with a Cisco Room device that can host Webex Meetings.

Management > Workspaces > Add workspace

  • Name: Rainbow Think Tank
  • Type: Meeting Room
  • Capacity: 15
  • Location: PPS Corporate
  • Floor: RainbowRaccoon floor (may need to scroll)
  • Device: Cisco Room and Desk device
  • Meetings: Device hosted meetings
  • Site: Choose Webex url from drop down
  • Activation code will be provided.
    • This code would then be entered on the device, but we will not need it for this lab.
    • The device will not appear in Control Hub until it has been activated, which we are not doing.

Consider the workspaces and devices in your organization

  • Where are the devices physically located?
    • Campus, building, floors
  • How are the spaces used?
    • Meetings rooms, open areas, huddle rooms, kiosks
  • How many people typically occupy those spaces?
  • What is each space’s capacity, and how does it affect device placement and use?
  • How will the devices support collaboration and user needs in each environment?

docs.title: Workspace Designer
docs.text:
Click here to open Workspace Designer

  • Practice creating a room design

Cisco Workspace Designer is a free, web-based tool that helps organizations design and deploy video-enabled hybrid workspaces efficiently. It provides customizable room blueprints and a 3D configurator to take meeting rooms from inspiration to reality.

docs.title: Lab 2 - First steps to optimization
docs.text: Before we dive into all the specific features of the Webex Suite, we'll need to lay the foundation for customized experiences using locations and groups. Locations organize users and devices by site, while Users and Groups streamline administration and policy management.

docs.title: Locations
docs.text:
Use case & solution Control Hub > Management > Locations > dCloud As PixelPals Studios grows, a scalable naming structure in Control Hub ensures efficient administration and easy management of future locations.
  • Give the main location a recognizable name.
    Overview > Location Info > Edit (Pencil Icon)
  • Location name: PPS Corporate
Specifying floors within locations will allow admins to easily assign devices, meeting rooms and users within specific areas of their offices. This helps with emergency services settings, troubleshooting and physical space utilization.
  • Create a floor to indicate where the RainbowRacoon game development team works at PPS Corporate.

Floors > Add floor

  • Floor number: 10
  • Floor name: RainbowRaccoon Floor
We'll come back to using floors later!

docs.title: Users
docs.text:
Use case & solution Control Hub > Management > Users Pro tip: As a shortcut, use the AI-powered smart search bar at the top of Control Hub to search by the user's name. As the main contact for contractor accounts, Ricardo Filice needs to manage their access efficiently and securely. For compliance, he should not have access to all organization-wide settings in Control Hub.
  • Assign the appropriate admin role to Ricardo.

    • Admin role descriptions

Ricardo Filice > Summary > Administrator roles

  • Grant the User and Device admin role
Kellie is a Contractor, but has the same settings as full time employees. Charles Holland (that’s you!) needs to understand what settings are already applied to an existing user.
  • Explore an existing contractor's user profile.

Kellie Melby

Look at Kellie’s user profile. Don’t make any changes!

  • Summary
    • Groups
    • Licenses
    • General
      • Messaging and Meetings
      • AI-generated summaries
    • Calling
      • Voicemail
      • User call experience > In-call feature access
        • Sharing content
      • Hide Calling Settings
    • Messaging
      • Collaboration Restrictions
    • Vidcast
      • Access
      • AI Feautres
      • Classifications

docs.title: Groups
docs.text:
Use case & solution Control Hub > Management > Groups > Webex groups PixelPals Studios needs to efficiently manage user access and feature settings based on users’ employment type.
  • Create a Group and assign appropriate users.
    • More about Group management.
  • Create a Group
    • Group Name: PPS Contractor Group
    • Description: Limited workload access for temporary employees
    • Group members: Kellie Melby, Eric Steele, Stefan Mauk

    • Don't click done when you see the high five!

  • Assign group resources
    • Licenses > Set up
      • Messaging: Advanced Messaging
      • Meeting: Webex Assistant for Meetings, Webex Meetings Suite
      • Calling: Webex Calling Professional

    • No need to apply to existing users. They already have these licenses.

Think about it: Within your company, which admin roles might you use and what Groups might you create?

docs.title: Lab access
docs.text:
• Labs will be conducted in Control Hub
  • Administrator login details are provided in the chart below
    • Use the account that corresponds to the student number your instructor assigned to you
  • Your login is Charles Holland, Webex full administrator

-CHART HERE-

docs.title: Using this guide
docs.text:
• The labs in the left navigation bar are arranged in the order you should complete them, based on their dependencies
  • You can also navigate between labs using the Previous and Next options at the bottom of each page
  • Look for hints and tips throughout the labs, which are displayed in italics
  • Please note, if you work ahead, questions cannot be answered until the group reaches that topic

The thinking cat indicates stopping points for discussion

docs.title: Lab 5 - Meetings
docs.text:
Webex Meetings offers a wide range of features for hosts and cohosts. And with Webex, the most secure. In this lab, you'll review which settings may need adjustment for your organization. Then, following the approach from earlier labs, you'll create and apply a template with specific limitations for a user group that requires additional controls.

The Meetings default vs template settings chart shows which Meetings settings are set by default and which you can change for groups using the template. Use the chart as a quick reference to compare default settings with customizable options to fit your organization’s needs.

Use Case Control Hub > Services > Meeting > Templates Pixel Pals Studios needs to create a meeeting template for contractors to ensure these users have only the features necessary for their roles.

Create Template

  • Template Name: PPS Contractors
  • Description: Internal Meetings
Limiting contractors to internal meetings only in Webex Meetings enhances your organization's security by preventing external exposure of sensitive information.

Meetings

Internal
  • Block all external users

External

  • Allow approved external sites
  • Add: cisco.webex.com, temprecruiters.webex.com
Tip: In each grouping going forward, Internal meeting setting is the first column; External meeting setting is the second. Disabling Slido for contractors prevents them from starting polls or Q&A sessions, which could otherwise lead to distractions or sharing of unintended information.

Collaboration tools

Polling, Q&A, Slido
  • Internal meeting and External meeting: Disable
Disabling recording capabilities for contractors helps safeguard your organization's confidential information, supports compliance with data management policies, and reduces security risks associated with uncontrolled recording and sharing of meeting content.

Recording

Cloud recording & Local Recording

  • Internal meeting and External meeting: Disable
Disabling remote control for contractors is a best practice to ensure secure collaboration and protect sensitive information during Webex meetings. Limit who contractors can pass remote control to and control of in internal and external meetings.

Remote Control

  • Turn on remote control:
    • Internal meeting: Enable
    • External meeting: Disable
We want to limit what can be shared with meeting attendees. We’ll turn off desktop sharing for both internal and external meetings. Turning off desktop sharing prevents confidential or private content being visible to meeting attendees.

Sharing

  • Enable Sharing: Internal and External Meeting: Enable
  • Internal and External Meeting: Disable Desktop Sharing
To reduce telephony costs, we want to limit contractors to “Toll” only. Although we do encourage use of computer audio for all meetings. Telephony

Call in

  • Enable Toll

Call back

  • Disable Host only
Apply template to PPS Contractor Group
  • Click Create template and next
  • Search “PPS Contractor Group”
  • Click Done

Think about it: What Meetings settings would you need to change?

docs.title: Lab 4 - Messaging
docs.text:
In this lab, you'll learn how to customize your organization's messaging settings. We'll discuss possible changes at the organization level, then use the Messaging template to apply settings for a specific user group.

The Messaging default vs template settings chart shows which settings are set by default and which can be customized for groups using the template. Use the chart as a quick reference to compare default settings with customizable options to fit your organization’s needs.

Use case & solution Control Hub > Services > Messaging > Settings > Templates Pixel Pals Studios needs to create a messaging template for contractors to ensure these users have only the communication features necessary for their roles while protecting sensitive company information.

Create Template

  • Template Name: PPS Contractors
  • Description: Internal Messaging

Collaboration Restrictions

Blocking file uploads for contractors in Webex Messaging helps maintain security, compliance, and data control.

Block file upload on

  • Webex web client
  • iOS and Android app
  • Mac and Windows app
  • Bots
    Restricting Bitmojis for contractors helps reduce inappropriate content risks, maintain consistent communication, and ensure compliance with company policies.

Allow Bitmoji sticker sharing

  • Disable
Apply template to PPS Contractor Group
  • Click Create template and next
  • Search “PPS Contractor Group”
  • Click Done

Think about it: What Messaging settings would you change for your organization?

docs.title: Lab 3 - Organization settings & general template
docs.text:
Organization settings form the backbone of your company’s Webex environment, providing consistency, security, and a customized experience for all users and devices. Some of these settings are best applied organization-wide, while others may be tailored using a template for specific groups of users. In this exercise, we’ll explore how to configure both types to best meet your organization’s needs.

The Organization default vs template settings chart shows which organization settings are set by default and which you can change for groups using the template. Use the chart as a quick reference to see default settings versus customizable options to fit your organization’s needs

docs.title: Organization settings
docs.text:
Use case & solution Control Hub > Management > Organization Settings Pro tip: Use Ctrl+F (PC) or Cmd+F (Mac) to find the setting on the page instead of scrolling. In the Webex App, employees and contractors should only be able to message internally and with approved external vendors, such as Cisco and Temp Recruiters, Inc.
  • Allow messaging with approved domains.

External Communication > External messaging

  • Allow selected domains only: Enable
  • Manage allowed domains
    • Add cisco.com, temprecruiters.com
    • You must check domains before clicking add
It can be difficult for contractors to remember peoples’ names during video meetings.
  • Enable the face recognition feature to identify meeting participants.

Face recognition

  • Allow Name Labels: Enable
  • Invite users: Take a look at the email template to invite users to enroll. No action required.
PixelPals wants their unique character names, games, and proprietary game engine terms to be excluded from spell check suggestions in Messaging and displayed correctly in meeting transcriptions.
  • Add unique words to the custom dictionary.

Custom Dictionary

  • Download CSV template
  • Edit CSV
    • Add PixelPals, PixelPunk, RainbowRaccoon, and CoinDash
Sometimes contractors finish a project but are asked to come back for another one a few weeks later.
  • Extend the time period for deleting inactive users.

Manage inactive user

  • Delete inactive users after 60 days
Leadership is concerned about unprofessional changes to user profiles. PixelPals fosters an inclusive and respectful workplace culture that respects individuals’ pronoun preferences.
  • Disable editing of certain user atttributes and enable the prounoun feature.

User Attributes > Edit user attributes

  • Required user attributes
    • Enable first name, last name, and display name
  • Editable user attributes
    • Turn off all editable user attributes
  • Pronouns
    • Enable allow pronouns
    • Enable Customizable by users
Employees should be able to make use of powerful AI features.
  • Most AI features are on by default. Turn on summaries for call recordings.

Cisco AI Assistant & AI features > Customize AI Assistant & AI features

  • Calling – Enable AI-generated summaries for call recordings
Security standards dictate specific password requirements.
  • Update the password policy.

Password policy

Hint: you will need to use the down carrot to open the Password policy options.
  • Minimum character length = 10
  • Days between password changes = 180
  • Passwords can’t contain: PixelPals
Due to privacy concerns, virtual backgrounds are required for all video calls and meetings.
  • Enforce the use of virutal backgrounds.

Virtual backgrounds

  • Allow virtual backgrounds: Keep default settings
  • Enforce virtual backgrounds for internal and external: Enable
    • Allow all admin-uploaded backgrounds for internal and external: Enable
  • Upload: PPS_virtualbackground.jpg
    • Opens in a new tab. Right click image to save to your desktop and then upload.

docs.title: General template
docs.text:
Organization default vs template settings chart

Use case & solution Control Hub > Management > Organization Settings > Templates PixelPals Studios needs to apply specific organization settings to the contractors.
  • Create a template to be applied to the PPS Contractors Group.

Create General template

  • Template name: PPS Contractors
  • Description: Security and privacy restrictions

Template Options

AI generated summaries could contain sensitive ideas, designs, or project plans that shouldn’t be shared outside the organization.
  • Disable summaries for Messaging, Meetings and recordings.

Messaging

  • Space summaries: Disable

Meetings

  • Disable all options

AI-generated summaries for recordings

  • Add AI-generated summaries to meeting recordings: Disable
Personal insights often analyze collaboration patterns, meeting data, and internal communications, which may expose information about team workflows, project status, or confidential activities. Contractors do not need access to this information.
  • Disable Personal Insights for contractors.

Personal Insights

  • Show Personal Insights: Disable
Contractors should not be able to upload their own or use PixelPal Studios branded virtual backgrounds.
  • Enable virtual backgrounds, but only those provided by Webex.

Virtual background

  • Allow Webex backgrounds: Enable
    • Disable all others
  • Enforce virtual backgrounds for internal and external: Enable
    • Allow all admin-uploaded backgrounds for internal and external: Enable
PDFs of digital whiteboard could contain sensitive ideas, designs, or project plans that shouldn’t be shared outside the organization.
  • Disable whiteboard exporting.

Digital Whiteboard

  • Allow exporting a whiteboard as a PDF file: Disable
Apply template to PPS Contractor Group
  • Click Create template and next
  • Search “PPS Contractor Group”
  • Click Done

Think about it: What organization settings might you need to restrict in your organization?

docs.title: Lab 9 - User profiles
docs.text:
We’re almost to the end! We've updated settings organization-wide and applied Webex Suite solution templates to our group of contract employees. Now, let's review where these changes appear for both regular and contract users.

Use case & solution Control Hub > Management > Users

Anita is a full-time employee. Let’s see her settings now that we’ve changed organization wide settings

Don't make any changes!

Hint: As a shortcut, use the AI-powered smart search bar at the top of Control Hub to search for Anita Perez.

Anita Perez

General

General template applied: None

  • Messaging: Space summaries, rewrite message, & message translation: Enabled
  • Meetings: All features enabled
Meetings

Meeting template applied: None

  • No changes to default settings
Calling

User calling template applied: None

Webex App calling template applied: None

  • Voicemail: Enabled
  • Call Recording: On
  • Hide Calling Settings: Click define custom user settings to see existing settings
    • Call Settings: Block caller ID: Disabled
    • Voicemail: All settings: Disabled
Messaging: Collaboration Restrictions

Messaging template applied: None

  • Animated GIFs, Bitmoji stickers, and previewing links: Enabled
Devices
  • 2 devices: 9841 and 9851
Vidcast

Vidcast template applied: None

  • Required classifications: Enabled
    • Classifications added: RainbowRaccoon, PixelPunk, CoinDash

Kellie is a Contractor. Let’s see her settings now that the templates have been applied.

Don't make any changes!

Hint: As a shortcut, use the AI-powered smart search bar at the top of Control Hub to search for Kellie Melby.

Kellie Melby

General

General template applied: PPS Contractors

  • Messaging: Space summaries: Disabled
  • Meetings: All features disabled
  • Virtual background
    • Allow Webex backgrounds: Enabled
    • All others: Disabled
    • Enforce virtual backgrounds for internal and external: Enabled
    • Allow all admin-uploaded backgrounds for internal and external: Enabled
  • Digital Whiteboard
    • Allow exporting a whiteboard as a PDF file: Disabled
Meetings

Meeting template applied: PPS Contractors

  • Settings
    • Internal: Block all external users
    • External: Allow approved external sites: cisco.webex.com, temprecruiters.webex.com
  • Collaboration tools
    • Polling, Q&A, Slido: Internal meeting and External meeting: Disabled
  • Recording
    • Cloud recording & Local Recording: Internal meeting and External meeting: Disabled
  • Remote Control
    • Turn on remote control:
      • Internal meeting: Enabled
      • External meeting: Disabled
  • Sharing
    • Enable Sharing: Internal and External Meeting: Enabled
    • Internal and External Meeting: Disabled Desktop Sharing
  • Telephony
    • Call in - Toll: Enabled
    • Call back - Host only: Disabled
Calling

User calling template applied: None

Webex App calling template applied: PPS Contractors

  • Voicemail: Disabled
  • Call Recording: On
  • Hide Calling Settings: Click define custom user settings to see existing settings
    • Call Settings: Block caller ID: Disabled
    • Voicemail: All settings: Disabled
Messaging: Collaboration Restrictions

Messaging template applied: PPS Contractors

  • Block file preview and download on: Enabled (all of the following)
    • Webex web client
    • iOS and Android app
    • Mac and Windows app
    • Bots
  • Allow Bitmoji stickers sharing: Disabled

Devices

  • 1 device: 9851
Vidcast

Vidcast template applied: PPS Contractors

  • Allow importing of Webex Meeting: Disabled
  • Allow external sharing: Disabled
  • Allow video downloads: Disabled
  • Required classifications: Enabled
    • Classifications added: RainbowRaccoon, PixelPunk, CoinDash

Think about it: What were the differences between the 2 users? Would you be able to override the template features at the individual user level as well?

docs.title: Lab 7 - Vidcast
docs.text:
Looking for alternatives to meetings? With Vidcast, users can quickly record, edit, and share video updates or presentations to streamline communication. In this lab, you'll review and set organization-wide settings, then create a template tailored for a specific user group-just as in previous labs.

The Vidcast default vs template settings chart shows which Vidcast settings are set by default and which you can change for groups using the template. Use the chart as a quick reference to see default settings versus customizable options to fit your organization’s needs.

docs.title: Organization settings
docs.text:
Use case & solution Control Hub > Services > Vidcast > Settings

Classifications help maintain consistent video content organization and supports compliance with company policies.

Classifications

  • Require classifications: Enable
  • Configure classification (click button)
    • Create classifications: RainbowRaccoon, PixelPunk, CoinDash
    • Click Add

docs.title: Template
docs.text:
Use case & solution Control Hub > Services > Vidcast > Templates Pixel Pals Studios needs a Vidcast settings template for their contractors to easily manage and control the specific Vidcast features and permissions for this group.

Create template

  • Template name: PPS Contractors
  • Description: Internal Vidcast

Classifications help maintain consistent video content organization and supports compliance with company policies.

Note: If we don't configure this in the template, it will override the Classification setting we did for the organization in the above step. That is, contractors would not be required to configure classifications.

Classifications

  • Require classifications: Enable
  • Configure classification (click button)
    • Create classifications: RainbowRaccoon, PixelPunk, CoinDash
    • Click Add

Disabling these settings prevents unauthorized sharing and distribution of video content, protects sensitive information, supports compliance, and ensures only trusted users manage and access content via streaming only.

  • Edit available Access features

Access

  • Allow importing of Webex Meeting: Disable
  • Allow external sharing: Disable
  • Allow video downloads: Disable
Apply template to PPS Contractor Group
  • Click Create template and next
  • Search “PPS Contractor Group”
  • Click Done

Think about it: How would your organization use Vidcast?

docs.title: That's a wrap!
docs.text: Take the survey to let us know how we did! Passcode: ControlHub

docs.title: Welcome
docs.text:
Join at Slido.com to participate in today's polls! Participant Code: #ControlHub

Join the conversation in our Webex Space, Optimizing Webex Suite for Control Hub Administrators.

docs.title: Learning objectives
docs.text:
By the end of the lab, participants will:

  1. Understand the Webex Suite workloads and how they provide solutions across industries and personas.  

  2. Configure and optimize each workload (Meetings, Messaging, Calling, Events, Vidcast, Slido, Whiteboard, etc.) using Control Hub.  

  3. Tailor deployments to meet the needs of different personas and organizational roles.

docs.title: Lab deliverables
docs.text:
Participants will leave the lab with:

  1. A fully configured Webex Suite deployment tailored to the organizational needs of the example customer.

  2. A detailed understanding of settings for all Webex workloads (Meetings, Messaging, Calling, etc.).

  3. Resources and tools to monitor adoption, troubleshoot issues, and optimize services.

docs.title: Customer scenario
docs.text:
Company Name: Pixel Pals Studios Industry: Video Game Development Creates colorful, family-friendly video and mobile games

Employees: Full-time game designers, artists, marketing, administrative and IT Anita Perez, Charles Holland, Rebekah Barretta, Ricardo Filice, Taylor Bard

Contractors: Freelance voice actors, musicians, and independent testers hired for specific game launches Kellie Melby, Eric Steele, Stefan Mauk

In this lab, you’ll simulate a real-world organization, Pixel Pals Studios, that employs both full-time employees and external contractors. To maintain security and productivity, the IT admin needs to ensure that full-time employees have access to the full range of Webex Suite features, while contractors are assigned a more restricted set of tools to minimize security risks and unnecessary access.

docs.text:

Webex Help Center

docs.title: Adding a Copy Button Without a Code Block
docs.text:
This will copy the following text: <copy>Text to copy</copy>

This will copy the following text: Text to copy

docs.title: Adding user specific variables into your lab guide
docs.text: There may be times in which you want to embed some attendee specific information into the instructions of your lab guide, like credentials or phone numbers, which will be used on multiple pages of your lab guide. You can gather the information via a form or you can pass a pre-encoded JSON string as a URL parameter to populate the variable values into the browser's session storage. Then you can use a simple HTML tag with a special class name to update the values in the lab guide. This feature can be combined with the copy button method above.

docs.title: Form Method
URL Method
docs.text:
If you have a lot of attendee variables in your lab, you may choose to precompile and encode them so that you can simply provide a URL link which will load all of their required information.

To see this in action, add this string at the end of the URL for any page on this site: ?eyJBZG1pbiI6ImFkbWluQHh5ei5iaXoiLCJQVyI6InNVcGVyU2VjcmV0MTIzISIsIkVQIjoiRVAxIiwiRE4iOiIrMTkxMDU1NTEyMTUyIiwiUXVldWUiOiJRdWV1ZTEiLCJRdWV1ZTIiOiJRdWV1ZTIiLCJUZWFtIjoiVGVhbTEiLCJUZWFtMiI6IlRlYW0yIn0=

docs.title: Initial Setup
docs.text: This lab guide template uses MKDocs to take your markdown documentation and transform it into an interactive web based lab guide. You will need to install some software on your PC or Mac in order to take full advantage of the tool which will allow you to view your changes as you save them and ensure that your formatting is exactly how you want it.

docs.title: Prerequisite Software to Install
docs.text:
1. Python
  2. Visual Studio Code
  3. Git

docs.title: Setting up your lab guide on your computer
Clone your repository with git
docs.text:
Open Visual Studio Code

Click the Source Control button in the left menu

Click Clone Repository

Enter the repository source: https://github.com/WebexCC-SA/LAB-1111.git

Select or create a new folder to clone the repository into.

docs.title: Build the environment
docs.text:
When prompted to open the cloned repository, select open.

Drag open the terminal at the bottom of the Visual Studio Code window

Show Me

If you are on a PCIf you are on a Mac

In your terminal enter the following commands:

python -m venv venv

Set-ExecutionPolicy -ExecutionPolicy RemoteSigned -Scope CurrentUser

venv\Scripts\activate.ps1

pip install -r requirements.txt

mkdocs serve

Open a browser to http://127.0.0.1:8000

In your terminal enter the following commands:

python -m venv venv

source venv/bin/activate

pip install -r requirements.txt

mkdocs serve

Open a browser to http://127.0.0.1:8000

docs.title: Using the tool after the initial setup
Using the tool after the initial setup
docs.text:
After the initial setup you will only need to take the following steps:

Open Visual Studio Code

Click the Source Control button in the left menu

Click Open Folder and navigate to the folder where you cloned the repository

If you are on a PCIf you are on a Mac

In your terminal enter the following commands:

venv\Scripts\activate.ps1

mkdocs serve

Open a browser to http://127.0.0.1:8000

In your terminal enter the following commands:

source venv/bin/activate

mkdocs serve

Open a browser to http://127.0.0.1:8000

docs.text: https://squidfunk.github.io/mkdocs-material/reference/

docs.text:
https://www.markdownguide.org/cheat-sheet/

https://github.com/lifeparticle/Markdown-Cheatsheet

docs.title: Publishing Your Changes
docs.text: As you progress with the creation of your lab guide, you should sync your changes periodically to GitHub.

docs.title: Syncing your changes to GitHub
docs.text:
Make sure that you have saved all of the files you want to sync up to the repository

Click the Source Control button in the left menu

Click the plus sign next to each file you want to sync as you hover over the file names or alternatively, click the plus sign next to changes

Enter a note about the changes you are making in the message text box

Click the down chevron on the commit button to reveal more options

Select Commit & Sync

docs.title: After you Sync your changes, it will take a few minutes for GitHub Actions to build the website so that you can view all of the changes you made.
